Two Diagrams

Diagram 1, Animation

The diagram depicts the man sitting at his computer, accessing a web client. He types in the address, www.cisco.com. The web browser sends a request to the ISP router, which forwards the request to the switch, and then to the DNS server, all of which are directly connected to the ISP router. The DNS server responds back to the client with the corresponding IP address. The client receives the information. It then contacts the web server with the corresponding IP address to obtain a web page.

The following text describes the animation:
One. The client uses DNS to obtain the IP address of the web server requested.
Two. Client sends an HTTP request to destination port 80 for HTML web page.
Three. Server sends HTML web page to the client.
Four. Client interprets the HTML and displays the web page for the user.
